medical_history.chief_complaint: Infection of Transjugular Intrahepatic Portosystemic Shunt (TIPS) devices.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 presented in May 1997 with acute upper gastroenterological bleeding. After a TIPS procedure, she presented again in April 2000 with a 3-day history of fever, rigors, and diarrhea. Patient 2 presented with acute bleeding from gastroesophageal varices shortly after a TIPS procedure. Patient 3 presented with an acute upper gastrointestinal hemorrhage five weeks after his TIPS procedure.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1: chronic liver disease and portal hypertension; Patient 2: chronic liver disease due to hepatitis C and von Willebrand disease; Patient 3: cirrhosis due to hepatitis B and non-Hodgkin lymphoma.
medical_history.social_history: Patient 1: known heavy alcohol consumption; Patient 3: history of alcohol use.
